questions.question: Do you prefer a male or female character?
answers: I strongly prefer a male character
I prefer a male character, but it's not essential.
I strongly prefer a female character.
I prefer a female character, but it's not essential.
I don't lean either way. Recommend me a character without considering this.

questions.question: Do you want DLC characters, including crossovers, recommended to you?
answers: Absolutely, I am willing to buy DLC if the character fits my playstyle.
I'm ok with it, but please prioritize non-DLC characters.
Please recommend me characters in the base game. I don't want to buy DLC.

questions.question: During a round, what would be your primary goal/something you enjoy most?
answers: Landing flashy, high damage combos to take the lead.
Dashing in and out as I chip my opponent down.
Getting close and personal with my opponent through aggression.
Waiting for my overzealous opponent to make mistakes that I can capitalize on.
I enjoy everything, please choose a versatile character for me.

questions.question: What would be your secondary goal/something you enjoy next? (Choose the same thing to double down)
answers: Landing flashy, high damage combos to take the lead.
Dashing in and out as I chip my opponent down.
Getting close and personal with my opponent through aggression.
Waiting for my overzealous opponent to make mistakes that I can capitalize on.
I enjoy everything, please choose a versatile character for me.

questions.question: What would be your favorite offensive method?
answers: Striking the moment the opponent overextends and whiffs a move.
A devastating counterhit when my opponent tries to attack.
Aggressive mixups that will keep them guessing.
Grappling and throwing is the way to go - you can't break them all.
Mindgames from plus frames that will suffocate the opponent to death.
Poking down the opponent down with a series of low risk moves.
So many options, I would like a character that can specialize in everything.

questions.question: What would be your next preferred offensive method? (Choose the same thing to double down)
answers: Striking the moment the opponent overextends and whiffs a move.
A devastating counterhit when my opponent tries to attack.
Aggressive mixups that will keep them guessing.
Grappling and throwing is the way to go - you can't break them all.
Mindgames from plus frames that will suffocate the opponent to death.
Poking down the opponent down with a series of low risk moves.
So many options, I would like a character that can specialize in everything.

questions.question: The opponent is on the ground - what do you want to do? (Okizeme)
answers: I aggressively dash in, looking for a followup mixup.
I take it safe and reset to neutral in a favorable position.
I would like a character that has options for both.
I don't have an opinion. Please don't take okizeme situations into consideration.

questions.question: Would you want to play a character focused around setups/pattern play?
answers: Absolutely! Please try to recommend me a character that focuses on setups.
I prefer setups, but it doesn't take priority over other options.
I hate setups! Please try to recommend me characters that don't have setups as their focus.
I prefer no setups, but I am willing to play a setup oriented character.
I don't really have an opinion. Please don't take setups into consideration.

questions.question: Would you want to play a character with lots of stances?
answers: Stances are great, please try to recommend me a stance heavy character.
I prefer having stances, but it doesn't take priority over other options.
I hate stance. Please try to recommend me characters that aren't stance heavy.
I prefer having no stances, but I am willing to play a character with stances.
I don't really have an opinion. Please don't take stances into consideration.

questions.question: Do you value your characters' built in movement? (backdash/sidestep)
answers: Yes, I think movement is very important
To an extent, characters with bad movement are frustrating to play.
It's not something I feel strongly about, please don't take movement into consideration.

questions.question: Would you prefer a character with built in evasion in their moveset?
answers: Yes, please prioritize a character with high evasion
I would enjoy high evasion, but it's not a priority for me.
I don't really have an opinion. Please don't take built-in evasion into consideration.

questions.question:
Recommend me characters that are: 
(Tiers are subjective, all characters are playable.)
answers: High tier only (regular TWT Ro 8 appearances, OP characters).
Mid tier only(good characters with some flaws).
Low tier only(characters with noticeable flaws).
No low tiers.
No high tiers.
I don't care about tiers, please don't take it into consideration.

questions.question:
One last thing, do you have preference on character difficulty?
(Difficulty is subjective, all characters are hard at first.)
answers: I prefer characters that I can learn the basics with. (simpler gameplan & execution)
I prefer characters that have a easier execution(commands) but harder gameplan.
I prefer characters that have a easier gameplan but harder execution(commands).
I prefer characters that have challenging execution and gameplan.
I don't have a preference on character difficulty.
Choose a "beginner friendly"character for me. I understand this is subjective.
